content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 46.12 - Exterior reflective markings

State Regulations
(a) Every school bus manufactured for use in
this State on or after April 1, 2000, and every school bus used in this State
on or after September 1, 2002, shall be equipped with exterior reflective
markings as follows: (1)
the rear of the
school bus shall be marked with reflective material to outline the perimeter of
the back of the school bus and of the rear emergency exit; (2)
(i) the
school bus shall have a horizontal application of strips of reflective
material, not less than 13/4 inches wide, above the rear windows, and above the
rear bumper from the edges of the rear emergency exit door to both corners of
the school bus with vertical strips of reflective material at each corner
connected to the horizontal strips; (ii)
the rear emergency exit shall be
outlined around its outside perimeter with strips of reflective material, not
less than 2.5 centimeters in width; (3)
the school bus shall have a horizontal
application of strips of reflective material, not less than 13/4 inches wide, the entire length of the sides of the school bus body and located equidistant
between the floorline and the beltline of the bus; and
(4)
reflective material may be applied to the
front and rear bumpers of school buses. If it is applied, such reflective
material shall be between 13/4 and 21/4 inches wide applied thereto at a 45
degree angle to the center line of the road surface. There shall be a two-inch
wide nonreflective strip between each strip of reflective material. (b) Reflective material. Reflective material shall mean reflective material as set forth in 17 NYCRR
720.4
(n)(2). (c) School bus, as
used in this section, is defined in section
142
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law, but shall only apply to buses used to transport 10
or more passengers. Notes
